intro: Antirrhinum linaria, commonly known as the common toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow or orange tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has linear, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed areas. Antirrhinum linaria is a perennial species that blooms from late spring to early autumn.
